application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
description: To carry out tree surgery, including a height reduction by 5m to three Hornbeams (G1 on application) and a height reduction by 3m to one Hornbeam (T1 on application), all within Area 1 on TPO 400
decision_conditions: The hornbeams can be viewed between the properties in Copse Wood way. They along with other nearby trees help to provide a gradual transition of mature tree cover between the dwellings in the Copse wood Estate and the nearby Ruislip woods National Nature Reserve (NNR).

The tree contributes to local biodiversity, and significantly contributes to the amenity and arboreal / wooded character of the Copse wood Estate Area of Special Local Character. Collectively they have a moderate to high amenity value.

The reason provided by the applicant for the completion of the work is "insurance company requirement" however no evidence has been provided by an insurance company to support this and they have ticked no to question 4.2 alleged damage to property. Furthermore, height reductions by as much as 5m are likely to leave the hornbeams with a topped unnatural appearance. Pruning it would unnecessarily introduce multiple wounds into their crowns, which would likely cause stress and lead to infecti
The removal of deadwood, dangerous / hanging branches and ivy:  This does not require the formal consent of the Council.
